context: In 2024, CyberArk remains a dominant force in the Identity Security and Privileged Access Management market, continuing to set the standard for securing privileged accounts across hybrid and cloud environments. However, the company faces increasing competition from vendors offering alternatives that address concerns about CyberArk's operational complexity, high licensing fees, SaaS lock-in, and rigid integrations. The PAM market has expanded dramatically, valued at $4.57 billion in 2024 and projected to reach $20.94 billion by 2032 with a 20.94% CAGR. Organizations now seek solutions offering Just-In-Time (JIT) access, granular access control, Zero Trust architectures, and cloud-native designs without the overhead traditionally associated with comprehensive PAM platforms. The competitive landscape includes established enterprise vendors, specialized PAM providers, and emerging cloud-native security startups.

competitors.name: BeyondTrust
competitors.notes: Prominent competitor recognized as a Leader in Gartner Magic Quadrant for PAM for seven consecutive years, specializing in privileged access management and vulnerability management with comprehensive safeguards for sensitive data and user access control

competitors.name: Delinea
competitors.notes: Formed from 2021 merger of Thycotic and Centrify, offering comprehensive PAM solutions with Secret Server and cloud-ready modern PAM based on Zero Trust principles, focusing on securing legacy and cloud environments with seamless integration

competitors.name: Microsoft Entra ID
competitors.notes: Named the best overall CyberArk Privileged Access Manager alternative, integrating privileged access management into comprehensive cloud identity and access management platform with native Azure integration

competitors.name: HashiCorp Vault
competitors.notes: Leading cloud-native secrets management alternative delivering strong integration and customization, appealing to organizations seeking flexible and cost-effective secret management with reliable cloud support and automated credential lifecycle

competitors.name: Okta
competitors.notes: Well-known cloud identity provider competing with strong platform for managing user access and securing applications, offering PAM capabilities through Advanced Server Access product

competitors.name: One Identity
competitors.notes: Providing comprehensive PAM suite with robust role-based access control and streamlined identity governance, highly customizable and working well for large enterprises with complex needs

competitors.name: ManageEngine PAM360
competitors.notes: Continuing to gain market share as a challenger offering simpler deployment and alternative licensing flexibility compared to CyberArk, catering to diverse organizational needs

competitors.name: WALLIX PAM
competitors.notes: Leading agentless PAM solution available as service or for deployment across on-premises, private, and public cloud infrastructures, delivering robust security oversight over privileged access to critical IT infrastructure

competitors.name: ARCON PAM
competitors.notes: Enterprise IT security solution offering highly scalable privileged access management working seamlessly in all IT environments to secure privileged account lifecycle

competitors.name: IBM Security
competitors.notes: Providing comprehensive cybersecurity solutions including privileged access management, identity governance, and threat intelligence with robust access controls, audit capabilities, and real-time monitoring

competitors.name: Silverfort
competitors.notes: Automatically detecting and classifying all privileged users, applying Just-In-Time policies across all users with real-time access control and MFA, featuring seamless integration across legacy, hybrid, and cloud ecosystems

competitors.name: StrongDM
competitors.notes: Specializing in Zero Trust Privileged Access Management within security domain, offering platform with policy-based controls, continuous authorization, and simplified access management to databases, servers, and Kubernetes

competitors.name: Zluri
competitors.notes: Offering cutting-edge access management solutions with accurate user access data discovery, effective employee access management, thorough monitoring of access activities, regular audits, and curated reports

competitors.name: Saviynt
competitors.notes: Providing identity governance and cloud security solutions competing in areas like access certification and privileged access governance

competitors.name: Britive
competitors.notes: Focusing on cloud-native privileged access management (CPAM), offering platform for access to cloud and hybrid environments while addressing standing privileges and access management for identities
